revised_title: Vapour Densities of Potassium and Sodium
tldr: This article describes an experimental method to determine the vapour densities of potassium and sodium using a new method invented by Professor Meyer. The authors found that due to the formation of an alloy with iron, it was difficult to obtain accurate results for potassium and sodium. However, the results were conclusive in showing the normal character of their respective vapour densities.
